00008 /**
00009  * @file git/odb.h
00010  * @brief Git object database routines
00011  * @defgroup git_odb Git object database routines
00012  * @ingroup Git
00013  * @{
00014  */
00015 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00016 
00017 /** An open object database handle. */
00018 typedef struct git_odb git_odb;
00019 
00020 /**
00021  * Open an object database for read/write access.
00022  * @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
00023  *            Set to NULL if the open failed.
00024  * @param objects_dir path of the database's "objects" directory.
00025  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error
00026  *         code describing why the open was not possible.
00027  */
00028 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_open(git_odb **out, const char *objects_dir);
00029 
00030 /**
00031  * Close an open object database.
00032  * @param db database pointer to close.  If NULL no action is taken.
00033  */
00034 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_odb_close(git_odb *db);
00035 
00036 /** Basic type (loose or packed) of any Git object. */
00037 typedef enum {
00038         GIT_OBJ_ANY = -2,               /**< Object can be any of the following */
00039         GIT_OBJ_BAD = -1,       /**< Object is invalid. */
00040         GIT_OBJ__EXT1 = 0,      /**< Reserved for future use. */
00041         GIT_OBJ_COMMIT = 1,     /**< A commit object. */
00042         GIT_OBJ_TREE = 2,       /**< A tree (directory listing) object. */
00043         GIT_OBJ_BLOB = 3,       /**< A file revision object. */
00044         GIT_OBJ_TAG = 4,        /**< An annotated tag object. */
00045         GIT_OBJ__EXT2 = 5,      /**< Reserved for future use. */
00046         GIT_OBJ_OFS_DELTA = 6,  /**< A delta, base is given by an offset. */
00047         GIT_OBJ_REF_DELTA = 7,  /**< A delta, base is given by object id. */
00048 } git_otype;
00049 
00050 /** An object read from the database. */
00051 typedef struct {
00052         void *data;          /**< Raw, decompressed object data. */
00053         size_t len;          /**< Total number of bytes in data. */
00054         git_otype type;      /**< Type of this object. */
00055 } git_rawobj;
00056 
00057 /**
00058  * Read an object from the database.
00059  *
00060  * If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.
00061  *
00062  * @param out object descriptor to populate upon reading.
00063  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00064  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00065  * @return
00066  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
00067  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00068  */
00069 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_read(git_rawobj *out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Read an object from the database using only pack files.
00073  *
00074  * If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.
00075  *
00076  * @param out object descriptor to populate upon reading.
00077  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00078  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00079  * @return
00080  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read.
00081  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00082  */
00083 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb__read_packed(git_rawobj *out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * Read an object from the database using only loose object files.
00087  *
00088  * If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.
00089  *
00090  * @param out object descriptor to populate upon reading.
00091  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00092  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00093  * @return
00094  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read.
00095  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00096  */
00097 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb__read_loose(git_rawobj *out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * Write an object to the database.
00101  *
00102  * @param id identity of the object written.
00103  * @param db database to which the object should be written.
00104  * @param obj object descriptor for the object to write.
00105  * @return
00106  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was written;
00107  * - GIT_ERROR otherwise.
00108  */
00109 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_write(git_oid *id, git_odb *db, git_rawobj *obj);
00110 
00111 /**
00112  * Release all memory used by the obj structure.
00113  *
00114  * As a result of this call, obj->data will be set to NULL.
00115  *
00116  * If obj->data is already NULL, nothing happens.
00117  *
00118  * @param obj object descriptor to free.
00119  */
00120 GIT_INLINE(void) git_obj_close(git_rawobj *obj)
00121 {
00122         free(obj->data);
00123         obj->data = NULL;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * Convert an object type to it's string representation.
00128  *
00129  * The result is a pointer to a string in static memory and
00130  * should not be free()'ed.
00131  *
00132  * @param type object type to convert.
00133  * @return the corresponding string representation.
00134  */
00135 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_obj_type_to_string(git_otype type);
00136 
00137 /**
00138  * Convert a string object type representation to it's git_otype.
00139  *
00140  * @param str the string to convert.
00141  * @return the corresponding git_otype.
00142  */
00143 GIT_EXTERN(git_otype) git_obj_string_to_type(const char *str);
00144 
00145 /**
00146  * Determine if the given git_otype is a valid loose object type.
00147  *
00148  * @param type object type to test.
00149  * @return true if the type represents a valid loose object type,
00150  * false otherwise.
00151  */
00152 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_obj__loose_object_type(git_otype type);
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * Determine the object-ID (sha1 hash) of the given git_rawobj.
00156  *
00157  * The input obj must be a valid loose object type and the data
00158  * pointer must not be NULL, unless the len field is also zero.
00159  *
00160  * @param id the resulting object-ID.
00161  * @param obj the object whose hash is to be determined.
00162  * @return
00163  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object-ID was correctly determined.
00164  * - GIT_ERROR if the given object is malformed.
00165  */
00166 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_obj_hash(git_oid *id, git_rawobj *obj);
00167 
00168 /**
00169  * Determine if the given object can be found in the object database.
00170  *
00171  * @param db database to be searched for the given object.
00172  * @param id the object to search for.
00173  * @return
00174  * - true, if the object was found
00175  * - false, otherwise
00176  */
00177 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_exists(git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00178 
00179 /** @} */
00180 GIT_END_DECL
